items.sentence: I've finally gotten used to doing it this way.
Tom told me that he doesn't understand French.
I'm not going to go back to Boston ever again.
Will both of these suitcases fit in the trunk?
Every Canadian I've ever met does it that way.
Tom asked Mary to stop asking silly questions.
Tom's sister didn't invite him to her wedding.
Tom's wife is pregnant with their third child.
Tom tried to learn to play a brass instrument.
I don't mind working with Tom when he's sober.
I'm confident that there won't be a world war.
Why do I always have to do everything for you?
Tom opened the door to his office and went in.
It's not polite to scream at people like that.
Mary bought a blue dress to wear to the dance.
Three years have passed since I was in Boston.
I have had a bellyful of Tom's nasty comments.
Tom doesn't want to be asked to do that again.
Tom needed to be notified, so I called him up.
That's the reason Tom doesn't want to do that.
